priorVersion.title: CDISC SDTM Microbiology Test Code Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C120527

self.title: CDISC SDTM Microbiology Test Code Terminology

definition: Terminology relevant to the microbiology test codes of the CDISC Study Data Tabulation Model.
name: Microbiology Test Code
preferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Microbiology Test Code Terminology

terms.definition: A measurement of any rod-shaped bacteria that resist decolorizing by acid after accepting an aqueous stain solution, due to the mycolic acids in their cell walls.
A measurement of the organisms that are not assigned to the species level but are assigned to the Burkholderia genus level in a biological specimen.
A measurement of a targeted deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the Ebola virus IgM antibodies in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the influenza A antigen in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the influenza A/B antigen in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the influenza B antigen in a biological specimen.
The identification of the type of a microbial organism in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the methicillin-resistant strain of Staphylococcus aureus in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the methicillin-susceptible strain of Staphylococcus aureus in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the organisms that are assigned to the Mycobacterium tuberculosis species in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the organisms assignable to the Mycobacterium tuberculosis complex in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the mucoid strain of Pseudomonas aeruginosa in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the non-mucoid strain of Pseudomonas aeruginosa in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the small-colony variant strain of Pseudomonas aeruginosa in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the Plasmodium knowlesi in an asexual replication stage in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the Plasmodium knowlesi in a sexual replication stage in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the organisms that are assigned to the Stenotrophomonas maltophilia species in a biological specimen.
The identification below the species level of an organism in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the Zaire ebolavirus present in a biological specimen.
